dict.string: Emu iOS
25847b0e1fc41bc665d204be1a2c96ee
The model of the user's device
A mnemonic name of the application. Currently: "Emu iOS". Used in case we will create white labels of the Emu app in the future.
The localized language preference on the user's device (good to know for the time we will want to localize the app).
The long build version string in the following format: <big>.<small>.<build#> for production application. or <big>.<small>.<build#>.t for test application.
The number of times the user launched the application.
The application was launched by the user.
The application entered the background (user pressed home screen, changed to another app, etc.)
The user launched or returned to the application.
The application was launched with a higher version than the version it was launched with previously.
<string> - the previous version the app was launched with
<string> - the current version the app was launched with
The recorder screen was opened and just appeared on screen. The event will also include info about the flow option the recorder was opened for.

<string> - the flow type definition the recorder was opened with. Possible values: 'onboarding' - recorder on boarding when app launched for the first time. 'retakeAll' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons 'retakePackage' - user wanted to retake and use the footage to all unlocked emoticons in a package. 'retakeEmoticon' - user wanted to retake and lock an emoticon to a specific footage taken for that emoticon.
<string> - the name of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the oid of the related emoticon (optional. only if recorder opened in the retakeEmoticon flow)
<string> - the name of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
<string> - the oid of the related package (sent even in onboarding according to the used package set in AppCFG)
